skill.name: git-advanced-workflows
skill.description: Master advanced Git workflows including rebasing, cherry-picking, bisect, worktrees, and reflog to maintain clean history and recover from any situation. Use when managing complex Git histories, collaborating on feature branches, or troubleshooting repository issues.
skill.summary: Master advanced Git workflows including rebasing, cherry-picking, bisect, worktrees, and reflog to m...

security_audit.summary: No code execution, network access, or credential access was found in the skill content. The file provides Git command guidance only.

content.user_title: Master advanced Git recovery and history editing
content.value_statement: Complex Git history work can be risky and confusing. This skill gives clear steps for rebasing, cherry-picking, bisecting, and recovery.
actual_capabilities: Explain interactive rebase operations and common use cases
Guide cherry-picking single commits or ranges
Walk through manual and automated git bisect workflows
Describe worktree setup for parallel branch work
Provide reflog based recovery steps for lost commits
limitations: Does not run Git commands or inspect repositories
Cannot resolve merge conflicts without user context
Does not validate project specific branching rules
No automation for cleanup scripts or hooks

use_cases.title: Clean feature branch history
use_cases.description: Prepare a linear, readable commit history before opening a pull request.

use_cases.title: Backport hotfixes
use_cases.description: Apply a single fix across multiple release branches safely.

use_cases.title: Find regression commits
use_cases.description: Use bisect steps to locate the commit that introduced a bug.

prompt_templates.title: Rebase basics
prompt_templates.scenario: Clean last five commits before PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Show the exact interactive rebase steps to squash and reword my last five commits safely.

prompt_templates.title: Cherry-pick range
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to cherry-pick a commit range onto release/2.0 and handle conflicts.

prompt_templates.title: Bisect workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Give a step by step git bisect process using a test command to locate a regression.

prompt_templates.title: Recover lost work
prompt_templates.prompt: Describe how to use reflog to recover a deleted branch and create a new branch from it.

output_examples.input: I accidentally reset my branch and lost commits. How do I recover them?
output: Check `git reflog` to locate the lost commit hash
Create a recovery branch at that hash
Verify the changes, then continue work from the recovery branch

best_practices: Create a backup branch before risky history edits
Keep commits small and descriptive for easier recovery
anti_patterns: Rebasing public branches used by collaborators
Force pushing without checking for remote updates
Running bisect with a dirty working directory

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all Git versions?
faq.answer: It works with modern Git versions that support rebase, bisect, worktree, and reflog.

faq.question: Does it handle my repository automatically?
faq.answer: No, it provides guidance only and does not run commands or modify files.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my CI or scripts?
faq.answer: It can suggest steps but does not execute or configure CI pipelines.

faq.question: Does it access my data or credentials?
faq.answer: No, it does not read files, environment variables, or network resources.

faq.question: What if I still cannot resolve a conflict?
faq.answer: Provide the conflict details and current status so it can suggest targeted steps.

faq.question: How is this different from basic Git help?
faq.answer: It focuses on advanced workflows like bisect, reflog recovery, and worktrees.
